name: The Pious of Pelor (Cleric 35 / Paladin 2 / Rogue 3)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Pious of Pelor 

Image source: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/10/ea/e7 ... 610e10.jpg


Introduction:
The famous class combination Cleric / CoT / Rogue is extremely popular and rightly so, with its power, its bonus feats, its versatility and its saves. 

Here I attempt to explore an alternative path, which is to utilise the Paladin Class instead of CoT to boost saves, provide some great immunities, and to also boost caster levels of the cleric much higher than the typical CoT build, to improve duration, spell penetration and increase the number of cleric bonus feats.

Another way to look at this build, is to see this build as a Combat Paladin with so many of the great features of the Paladin class, but with a level 9 cleric spell book with 35 caster levels.

The class combo, similar to most paladin builds which are Multiple-Attribute-Dependent builds, was challenging to make well, the only stat I could dump was Dex. 

I used Bonus Feat Cheese from Epic Cleric levels to boost Wisdom, which was not ideal delaying level 7-9 cleric spells to mid epic levels, but the best way to give the build a decent AB.

Goals:
- Base Melee AB 37+ with BAB 25 (to make the most out of Divine Power)
- Blind Fight/Knockdown
- Divine Might with Cha 16+
- 350hp+
- Full Cleric Level 9 Spell Book, undispellable and Mord's resistant
- Some metamagic feats (ie Extend) and Craft Wand

Outcomes:
- Base Melee AB 37 (WF/EWF/EP) with BAB 25, Blind Fight/Knockdown
- 398 base HP (cappable to 638 HP)
- +10 AC from Tumble and Armor Skin
- Fort 28 (36) Will 28 (36) Reflex 20 (28)
- Divine Might, Base Cha 16
- Full Cleric Level 9 Spell Book with CL 35, Extend/Empower Spell, Craft Wand
- 208 skill points (Concentration, Spellcraft, Tumble, UMD, Spot)
- No exp penalties

Strengths:
- Paladin with a full cleric high caster level spellbook, Mord Resistant, High spell penetration
- Fear and Disease immunity
- High potential with capped stats ie. Fort save of 40(48) with Cha and Con capped
- Metamagic and Crafting
- Parties


Weaknesses:
- Mords/Breaches
- Silences
- Will want lots of stats from items
- Flanking sneak attacks
- Low spell DCs

Wishlist:
- Earlier cleric 7-9 spells
- Melee AB 38
- Base Cha 18
- More skill points to put into rogue skills (ie DT)
- Scribe scroll to craft heal/mass heal scrolls
- Silent and Maximize Spell
- Some points in Taunt

Build details (after suggestions, 7/3/2020):
SpoilerCleric(35), Paladin(2), Rogue(3), Human PvM solo or party DEX: 8 WIS: 14 (20) CHA: 14 Human: (Quick to Master) 02: Cleric(1): Domain Healing, Domain Strength 04: Cleric(2): WIS+1, (WIS=15) 06: Cleric(4): Extend Spell 08: Cleric(6): WIS+1, (WIS=16) 10: Cleric(8) 12: Cleric(10): WIS+1, Silent Spell, (WIS=17) 14: Cleric(12) 16: Cleric(14): WIS+1, (WIS=18) 18: Cleric(16): Scribe Scroll 20: Rogue(2): STR+1, {Evasion}, (STR=16) 22: Cleric(18) 24: Cleric(20): STR+1, Great Strength I, (STR=18) 26: Cleric(22) 28: Cleric(24): STR+1, (STR=19) 30: Cleric(26): Great Strength II, Automatic Silent Spell I, (STR=20) 32: Cleric(28): STR+1, (STR=21) 34: Cleric(30) 36: Cleric(32): STR+1, Great Strength IV, Automatic Silent Spell III, (STR=24) 38: Cleric(33) 40: Cleric(35): STR+1, Great Wisdom II, (STR=26), (WIS=20) Hitpoints: 398 Saving Throws (Fortitude/Will/Reflex): 27/27/19 BAB: 25 AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 17/28 Alignment Changes: 0 Concentration 43(45), Disable Trap 1(2), Open Lock 1(0), Search 12(13), Set Trap 1(0), Spellcraft 39(40), Spot 40(45), Tumble 40(39), UMD 31(33) 02: Concentration(5), Spellcraft(5), Save(20),  04: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(2), Save(24),  06: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(28),  08: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(32),  10: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(36),  12: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(40),  14: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(44),  16: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(48),  18: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(52),  20: Search(7), Spot(19), Tumble(20), UMD(19),  22: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(2), Save(1),  24: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(5),  26: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(9),  28: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(13),  30: Concentration(1), Save(19),  32: Concentration(1), Save(25),  34: Concentration(1), Save(31),  36: Concentration(1), Save(37),  38: Concentration(2), Spellcraft(2),  40: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(3), 


Old build
SpoilerCleric(35), Paladin(2), Rogue(3), Human Designed for PvM solo or party STR: 14 (26) CON: 14 INT: 12 01: Rogue(1): Power Attack, Blind Fight 03: Cleric(1): Weapon Focus: Warhammer, Domain Healing, Domain Strength 05: Cleric(3) 07: Cleric(5) 09: Cleric(7): Empower Spell 11: Cleric(9) 13: Cleric(11) 15: Cleric(13): Craft Wand 17: Cleric(15) 19: Paladin(2): {Smite Evil} 21: Cleric(17): Epic Weapon Focus: Warhammer 23: Cleric(19) 25: Cleric(21) 27: Cleric(23): Great Strength I, Great Wisdom I, (STR=18), (WIS=17) 29: Cleric(25) 31: Cleric(27) 33: Cleric(29): Great Strength III, Great Wisdom III, (STR=22), (WIS=19) 35: Cleric(31) 37: Rogue(3): {Uncanny Dodge I} 39: Cleric(34): Great Strength V, (STR=25) Skillpoints: 208 Saving Throw bonuses: Spells: +8 AB (max, naked): 37 (melee), 25 (ranged) Spell Casting: Cleric(9) 01: Disable Trap(1), Open Lock(1), Search(4), Set Trap(1), Spot(4), UMD(3), Save(26),  03: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(6), Save(22),  05: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(26),  07: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(30),  09: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(34),  11: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(38),  13: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(42),  15: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(46),  17: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(50),  19: Concentration(1), Save(55),  21: Concentration(2), Spellcraft(2),  23: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(3),  25: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(7),  27: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(1), Save(11),  29: Concentration(1), Save(17),  31: Concentration(1), Save(23),  33: Concentration(1), Save(29),  35: Concentration(1), Save(35),  37: Search(2), Spot(17), Tumble(20), UMD(8), Save(1),  39: Concentration(1), Spellcraft(3), 
Comments / suggestions welcome as always

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
You are trying to do too much with this build and the result is a build that is mediocre.

Clerics are exceedingly versatile but the various builds are not synergistic.

Meaning a caster cleric is excellent, a battle cleric is excellent, a charisma cleric is ... reasonable. But a caster/battle/charisma cleric is weaker than the sum of its parts, not greater. Even the Domains are unfocused. For a build like this, you should have Travel > War/Plant/Trickery > Strength > everything else.

This cleric is super stat starved, mechanically the best Domains would be Travel/War allowing you to focus on capping Wis and Charisma. On worlds with haste items, War and Plant/Trickery/Strength would be the best.

Healing is a poor choice for this build, strength is not bad given you will not have 7/8/9th level spells on a deep cleric build until you are well into epics and you have some Charisma. That said, very few once per day feats are worth building for., but yay more divine power.

As far as doing it all, this is close to the best you can do. I would take an early +1 Wisdom in stat gains, swap armor skin into a cleric bonus feat and drop whatever stat gain you replaced into the current armour skin slot. Netting you 7th level spells earlier.

I would also, recommend deciding what type of cleric you want and focus your build in that direction. A battle charisma/divine cleric is admittedly the more complicated of the 3. The reason people use CoT is to remove the 4th stat dependency (Charisma) from the equation.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Zanithar
Thanks for commenting

I am confused by your comment by mediocre. It's an awful word to label a build within a few moments of reading it, 
I prefer to use the word exciting. This build attempts to challenge an extremely old and crusty build concept, the Cleric/CoT/Rogue power build.
Can we build on this and do even better? Already the caster levels are better, and the saves *might* be better as well!

I presume when you used that term you are looking at single elements expecting a super powerful specialist (ie hyperpowered Dev Critter, hyperpowered Zen Archer/implosion Cleric) which this build is not.
This is more of a fabulous generalist. When you view it from this perspective it is far more enjoyable than the other two I have linked.
And of course compared with a paladin it seems hardly mediocre with a full 9th cleric spellbook with caster level 35, any AB lost from a lower BAB + Str stat is made up from Cleric being able +20 AB cap easily (ie. DP 5 GMW 5 DF 5 Bless 1 Aid 1 Prayer 1 +18 AB without trying), base melee 37 AB will be close to 63 in reality including Str bonuses

Both Boccob's Devastator and Demolition Man have average fortitude and terrible reflex saves and 20-25% less HP saves wise this guy beats them by 4-8 points which is 1.5 a save item like an Ring of Fortitude +4, even more considering CHA can be buffed further, this cleric can frontline much more effectively than those two offensively focused builds, in a challenging environment this is valuable
In terms of tankability add Empowered Endurance / Eagle's Splendor and a few items the saves are going to be fabulous combined with so much HP (likely around 500-600 with empowered Endurance) and evasion
I felt I had to put divine might in the build otherwise it didn't seem to be a proper paladin, although I could drop it for Silent and Maximize
If I bring this guy to a PvM party I am going to worry less about him dying than the other two builds who pack a punch

RE domains I chose Strength/Healing because it seemed the best of a bad bunch for lawful good humans on the Deity search, I could have gone Animal + Plant of course, but one gets bored of seeing Animal + Plant clerics all the time. In other environments your suggestions are very reasonable. I like healing teammates by the way, wanted to give that domain a go for free empowered healing.

One thing I forgot to do because it was late and I was tired was to link other Cleric 30+ / Paladin / (Rogue) builds I could find, I did read a few (except Valerfor's - forgot to search DPA's engine) before posting:

ECB Archives
Builds with 30 to 40 levels of cleric, 1 to 40 levels of paladin, and 0 to 40 levels of any class.
All races are included. Builds are sorted by class. Matches found: 5

Blade of the Inquisition paladin 2 / cleric 35 / blackguard 3 (human) by grizzled_dwarflord
Spellslinger cleric 35 / fighter 4 / paladin 1 (human) by BattleRaptor
Divine Shield of Faith cleric 30 / paladin 1 / monk 9 (human?) by Revenant Mattlov
Field Guardian cleric 38 / paladin 1 / monk 1 (human) by Vulcano
Cheesely of the Divine cleric 32 / paladin 5 / rogue 3 (human?) by DaMouse404

ECB Filter Search by DPA
Found 1 result out of 310 builds - 0.32% builds match criteria:
Clc 35 / Pal 3 / Mnk 2 - Justicar - by Valerfor on Feb 16 15 1:03 AM

Anyway if you look through these builds you will quickly notice the base AB is a lot less (25-31) for a few of them, I was not game to to lower it too much but I am happy to do so, the thing I figure though, was the extra Str / AB was more valuable than the extra Cha for saves which was good enough, although I could lower Str by 2 and increase Cha by 2 just to give DM a bit more duration, thing is DM is nice, but I found only really useful when you have an opponent who has high damage reduction, I'd rather keep thwacking them with a extended divine favor / divine power and a Darkfire'ed GMW +5 warhammer with 26(38) Str than use up a round to cast DM


Edit: RE armor skin, its a bonus cleric feat from Cleric 32, after taking Great Wisdom as bonus feats at Cleric 23, 26 and 29 to get level 7, 8 and 9 spells respectively, its crappy it comes so late but I didn't want to kill this build's AB down to low 30s like a few of the others
re wisdom stat gains, I take +1 wis at level 12 to access level 6 spells the next level

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
Greetings Orion, and thanks for sharing another build and the continued pursuit of excellence.  For those unaware, his Domain choices are based on the traditional deity portfolio for Pelor, which consists of Good, Sun, Strength and Healing.

Another domain combo you could go with here is to synergize your Charisma with the Sun and Good Domains (Sun giving you a distinct advantage vs, undead, and Good to enable you to turn Outsiders).  There's a number of environments where Outsiders end up being in the epic portions of games.  It would also give you Stoneskin access to give you a nice buff and allow you to buff your summons.  

Regarding the build itself, I would hesitate to label it mediocre.  With Cleric as your major, it tends to cover up the blemishes everywhere else.  This would be a nice party build (for not all builds should be judged on their merit as a soloist).  However, like Zanithar, I do balk at the last Wisdom development.  At Cleric level 23 (char level 27) you finally are able to cast 7th level spells, and Level 9 spells don't come until Cleric level 29.  So in the meantime, while you achieve undispellability, there's diminishing returns on the rest of those cleric levels.  I would be more inclined to get Wisdom to 19 as soon as possible, and then raise your Charisma and Strength.  So that makes me naturally wonder why 35 Cleric levels at all if you are not going for casting here?  You could probably afford to drop a few in favor of another Paladin for a Taunt dump, and a few more Rogue levels for extra skill points and sneak.

Regarding Charisma and Divine Might, my goals when including this in a build is to shoot for a base of 20.  Anything short of that is hard to justify the investment (a class slot, Power Attack, Divine Might, Divine Shield if one goes that direction too).  Others may have a different opinion on that, and sometimes it's environment dependent.  One of the things I like to do is to give up the idea of dedicated melee and go for Wisdom/Zen Archery and then deliver Divine damage from a ranged position.  But these tend to be a different kind of build.

I know why you placed Empower Spell in the build, but it would be hard to pass up Silent Spell for a retinue of Silent Harms and Silent Word of Faiths.  I think a build like this would highly benefit from Silent Spell so you can muzzle casters and then beat on them with your divine and magic damage.

All that said, this build is totally playable and should be fun.  Moradin knows I have 50 dozen builds that are great concepts and nifty in many ways, but they just aren't "power builds".

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Fair enough, mediocre was not the correct word to use. Perhaps in conversation with appropriate tone but it is not appropriate in hindsight using toneless text. My apologies, any cleric build that is 24+ levels will not be a mediocre unless you skip the prerequisite wisdom.

Now on to the logic puzzle. In the spectrum of cleric builds it struggles to offer a general solution. It has a solid AB, absolutely, but in the quest to capitalise on all a cleric has to offer it has a large number of issues to mitigate.

This build will work, it meets the criteria. It just tries to do to many things and the underpinnings to make it all work well are not there.

You will struggle in most modules to cap all the stats you need. Meaning your AB suffers or your saves/divine feat duration suffer or your spell slots suffer or your HP suffer, likely more than 1. One mitigation for this is to have the War Domain, which you do not have, another is Paladin spells, a third I can think of is Blackguard Bull’s Strength. It is unlikely you can cap all the stats you need and if you do, I cannot help but wonder if you stripped way the Paladin saves synergy and added targeted saves whether or not you could hit the same save level. It is unlikely on most modules that you would hit both the stat caps AND the save caps so the Paladin save synergy of not applying to the save caps is unlikely to be in play here.

Your divine might takes 2 feats and an investment in charisma (which synergizes with your saves) and lasts 9 rounds, assuming you can cap Charisma (assuming base 16 is correct), which in turn impacts likely several other things you need capped. Mitigation for this is to increase your Charisma and cap it which decreases your Strength and makes you choose which of your other stats will miss being capped. This path is missing the 3rd feat (Divine Shield), not the end of the world, but nit capitalising on all the synergy has to offer.

You have deep caster level which offers some serious power if you are an offensive caster or can use extended Aura of Vitality, Haste, Regen, Battletide with a side of Prayer. The most powerful of these spells are unavailable in your spell lineup due to Domain limitations and you will also be limited to DCless spells because you did not invest in Wisdom. Many of your powerful spells will also arrive quite late in your build. A cleric has some decent spells that work, like harm, but you leave a lot of clerical spell power on the table for such a large investment. It does still offer solid dispel resistance and nets several extra feats (used for wisdom to cast higher level spells) but lacks the other synergies. The dispel resistance is excellent but Breach is still going to hurt. Also, until that breach hits your Spell Resistance spell, you are going to have some solid spell mitigation in place :)

You invest heavily in Strength which makes for an excellent strength battle cleric especially once you add divine might to the equation but it has a heavy reliance on so many low duration spells/feats to keep the engine moving well. It is hard to juggle hitting stuff with keeping all those spells and feats chugging along. This is no different than any other battle cleric. You will have an advantage for some cleric spells but a disadvantage on Divine Might.

In each case, going half way down the path stunts a lot of the what each path offers and having all paths does not balance out what focusing in one or two of them would offer. I am not even talking powergaming here, justoverlapping a few of the synergies better/at all.

Being a cleric however plugs enough of the holes that it will work, but you will struggle to meet everything you need.

Pick your focus(es) and strip out a stunted path or two and see the synergies shine.

Drop divine might and add War for example (perhaps BG over Paladin).

Trim some cleric levels and bump Paladin for some hit points, paladin abilities. Make use of that extend feat across some Paladin spells. For example 14 Paladin nets 14 round holy sword, 56 minute extended bless weapon and helps mitigate your stat capping issue with Aura of Glory.

Drop Paladin, go BG and review Domain options with War and Strength perhaps.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hail GDL and Zanithar 

Thank you for your comments
It is great to hear suggestions from such experienced cleric players, much more experienced than I

In terms of features I am seeing (and hearing from both of you, which both of you have helped me see) the following:
- Melee AB - good and probably fun!
- HP / defenses / saves - good and probably fun!
- Spellcasting - could be better, not as fun as we would like, but is ok
- Added divine damage from divine might - pretty poor except in a high magic environment, probably not fun

I want do some pruning as suggested, drop the non-fun last feature being added divine damage. This allows me to drop power attack / divine might, and take silent spell and maximize (or scribe scroll / luck of heroes / great fortitude / toughness) instead. I can drop the two +cha increases for two wisdom increases, getting the level 7-8-9 spells sooner. Spellcasting is therefore better whilst retaining good saves from the CHA and just forgetting about going for DM. 

I'll end the suggestions into the main post, thanks for the suggestions

I actually am unsure how maximize applies to clerics by the way, I hear about maximize blade barriers for example, maximized healing (with healing domain) combines both empowered healing and maximize according to the Wiki, which is interesting, it might not necessarily be the best reason to take the feat, and perhaps extra saves / HP might be better anyway

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
I think deep CL on a battle cleric is very interesting, Spell Resistance (the Spell) is 12+CL which on a 35 CL cleric is 47. This alone is powerful, add to that 70 Round near undispellable Haste/BattleTide/Regen/AoV/Divine Power/Prayer with a splash of Divine Favor is pretty awesome. Now add 70 round silence to this and perhaps silent Harm/Blade Barriers and you are cooking.

The Heal Domain would be powerful IF the empower acted on Heal, sadly in the uncustomized NWN toolset, it does not. I suspect because, like Harm, neither spell gained benefit from Empower/Maximize under the original spell definition.




Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
For enemies without evasion/improved evasion, even a low DC Blade barrier will dice and slice them (and they stack for extra tastiness). I tend not to Empower/Maximize mine as it is effective without it, if it hits at all and my level 8/9 spell slots are busy with other things, extra so on a battle cleric which doubles down on their lack of spell slots. I do consider Empower/Maximize on stuff with high DR. That all said, I tend not to take Maximize, it is pretty niche on a cleric.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content: I hardly ever select Maximize Spell for my caster Clerics.  There's not much I want to Maximize.  Blade Barriers are better Empowered and thus soaking up your Level 8 slots, and then using your Level 7 slots for Silenced Harms.  I lay multiple Blade Barriers down in one spot near a choke point, and then lure everyone to their death.  If somehow they make it across, I lure them back across for the coup d'etat.  Empower is also useful for your ability buffs.  For a non-caster cleric, I would go Extend and Silent and only take Empowered if you have room.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I really like silence on my meleers, as GDL has taught me, it is really fun to watch those casters run away in terror from the circular aura that is about to envelop them, if it is mord resistant and unbreachable even better
One other idea would be to incorporate auto-silent I-III into the build which would be fun
Would there be adverse implications of doing this in terms of spell book management?

Thanks for your response RE maximize, I might just forget about maximize and just stick with empower, which is valuable given this is a M-A-D build, particularly to boost HP / saves especially Fort

Edit:
Noted this in the NWN Wiki: Silence
One common source of this effect is the silence spell.

This effect is easier to dispel than most, as its creator's level is zero in the dispel check.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
But they can’t dispel it if they’re inside of it.


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
Rather circular issue :)


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
UNLESS they are auto-stilled and cast it.

But then, why dispel it?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
One other question - if I go Paladin 3 and Cleric 
-> do I get double the number of turn undead attempts / day?

I am curious

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: No, you would still have 3 base Turn Undead attempts even if you made a Cler/Pal/BG.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for the help.

Another question - can Word of Faith become empowered?
I am really liking Healing + Strength domains.
Cure minor feels like cure light. 
Empowered cure serious at level 2 (cast without even memorising it) its like casting a lvl 5 spell at level 2.
I got a 39 HP heal just from it, its seriously good as a low level character.
It is also quite handy as a Str melee cleric to cast cure spells on damage resistant undead with empowered healing, very little resists positive energy damage. 

This is what my spell list looks like with those two domains and Silent Spell / Empower Spell / Extend Spell / Auto-Silent I-III in the build, what would you suggest?

Cantrips Light / Cure Minor - Healing domain not memorised
1 Divine Favor 
2 Extended Divine Favor / Cure Serious - healing domain not memorised
3 Divine Power / Extended Silence
4 Extended Divine Power / Empower Stats
5 Extended Divine Power / Heal
6 Harm / Blade Barrier
7 Extended Blade Barrier / Silent Harm / Word of Faith
8 Empowered Blade Barrier / Silent Word of Faith
9 Silent Mass Heal / Empowered Word of Faith

Plus Shield of Faith (1) Bless (1) Prot v Evil (1) Aid (2) Ultravision (2) Darkfire (3) Magic Vestment (3) x2 GMW (4) Ext NEP (4) Ext Freedom (5) Ext Death Ward (5) etc etc... depending on items I have equipped

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content: As there are no variable effects, one cannot Empower Word of Faith.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content: Thanks Web. I'll probably have to put Implosion / SoV / Summon IX in the last slot

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
There are a lot of options with clerics. I tend to add all the extended buffs I want on a melee cleric then take a look at the remaining slots and figure out what I want to do.

I think you will find Implosion will be a little lacklustre with low DC except to clean out the chaff which SoV (using a different save) will typically be more effective.

Meaning more SoV, less Implosion for you is my advice.

You will have to be hyper conscious of saves especially on short duration damage spells. Something like an empowered BB will get them sooner or later ... Implosion does not function as well in this fashion (for example).

Lots of Harms, lots of SoV, Word of Faith. Play with BB and Implosion and Hammer of the Gods to figure out where it will work for you. Firestorm is also niche good for those high reflex but no evasion hordes.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
I probably missed some parts of the conversation, but at the end have you swifted "divine might" with "silent spell"?
if so, the remaining bonuses related to paladin class are saves + immunity to fear.

In this case, would you replace 2 CHA with (for example) 2 STR to have +1 AB?

Thanks for having shared your comments and suggestions, they help improve gameplay; if I have had to built a melee cleric with deep cleric levels myself, I would have only thought at CL35/F2/Rog3 or CL35/F4/Rog 1.....

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Aquarius
That is correct, I have dropped power attack and divine might for silent spell and scribe scroll.
I have changed the two +CHA increases for two +WIS increases to get spells 7-8 faster
I also took Auto-Silent I-III as cleric bonus feats.
That self silence aura combined with combat ability + spells such as Harm with a great melee touch attack seems very lethal
I have updated the main post to reflect this
The build could also be called 'Silent Healing and Harm' 

Playtested the build to about level 15 so far
It is devilishly easy to play, and stronger than any pure paladin build for sure
Healing domain boosts efficiency with cure pots by 50% 
Meaning I am literally giving away cure pots, I gave 90 cure pots to another player just recently 
Also I am looking forward to spamming cure critical wands with healing domain in a party
Strength is nice mostly to fill 3 with divine power and for stoneskin
War which is Zanithar's suggestion, would have been great, with empowered Cats and extended Aura of Vitality to help fill 8.
Searing light on a wand is great against undead. Hammer of the gods is also nice on a wand too. (there are heaps of cleric spells which are great on wands)

Spells at present
1 - Divine Favor
2- Ext Divine Favor / Empowered Cure Serious
3- Divine Power / Ext Self - Silence
4- Empowered Stats / Ext Divine Power
5- Ext Divine Power / Heal
6- Harm
7- Silent Harm
8- Empowered Blade Barrier
9- SoV/Summon IX/silent Mass Heal
